term.title: Taft equation

item.text: Various equations are associated with R.W. Taft, but the term is most often used to designate the family of equations that emerged from Taft's analysis of the reactivities of aliphatic esters, and which involved the polar substituent constant σ * and the steric substituent constant E s: log 10 k = log 10 k 0 + ρ * σ * is usually replaced by the related constant σ I.

item.alttext: log 10 k = log 10 k 0 + ρ * σ *
